code_quality.justification: Excellent code quality with JSDoc comments on all functions, clear descriptive naming (validateEmail, checkPasswordStrength, formatPhoneNumber), well-organized constants (EMAIL_REGEX, COMMON_PASSWORDS), proper TypeScript types throughout. Good use of discriminated unions for ValidationResult. Code is idiomatic and readable.

architecture.justification: Clean separation with each validator in its own module (email.ts, password.ts, phone.ts). Types centralized in types.ts. Single responsibility maintained. Index.ts provides clean re-exports. Discriminated union pattern for results is elegant and enables type narrowing. Easy to extend with new validators.

test_quality.justification: Comprehensive test coverage with well-organized describe blocks (valid/invalid/edge cases). Tests cover happy paths, error cases, and edge cases like whitespace handling and normalization. Good use of type narrowing in assertions. However, no parametrized tests (it.each), no fixtures, and some tests could be more thorough (e.g., more boundary conditions for password scoring).

error_handling.justification: Excellent error handling with specific, user-friendly error messages ('Email address cannot be empty', 'Phone number cannot contain letters'). Each validation function handles empty input, whitespace, and format-specific edge cases. Password validator provides actionable feedback array. All errors returned via typed result objects, no exceptions thrown.

summary: Senior-level TypeScript validation library with clean architecture, excellent typing, comprehensive tests, and helpful error messages. Minor improvements possible in test parametrization and a few additional edge cases.
